meanings.definition: Showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
meanings.sent1: The students were apathetic about the boring lecture.
meanings.sent2: She seemed apathetic towards the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent3: Even the dog looked apathetic when presented with a treat.
meanings.sent4: His apathetic response to the urgent situation shocked everyone.
meanings.sent5: The apathetic atmosphere in the room made it hard to stay awake.

meanings.definition: Having or showing little or no emotion.
meanings.sent1: The actor's apathetic expression failed to convey any emotion.
meanings.sent2: She gave an apathetic response to the sad news.
meanings.sent3: The apathetic robot's attempt at smiling was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her apathetic demeanor was like a mask hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The apathetic tone in his voice made it hard to believe he cared at all.

meanings.sent1: The customer service was apathetic to the complaints of the customers.
meanings.sent2: He remained apathetic to the ongoing debate.
meanings.sent3: The apathetic plant didn't seem to care about being watered.
meanings.sent4: The apathetic sky mirrored his mood perfectly.
meanings.sent5: Her apathetic attitude towards her own success was puzzling.
